title: Venezuelan opposition leader Machado says she presented Nobel medal to Trump
byline: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado said she had presented her Nobel Peace Prize to U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday during a high-stakes encounter that could affect how Trump seeks to shape the South American country’s political future.

title: President inaugurates ‘Windscape Mannar’ 20 MW wind power plant in Mannar
byline: In line with the Government’s programme to achieve the target of net zero carbon emissions by 2050, the 20-megawatt ‘Windscape Mannar’ wind power plant constructed in Mannar by CEYLEX Renewables was officially connected to the national grid yesterday (15) under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Mainly fair weather expected to prevail today
byline: Mainly fair weather will prevail in the most parts of the island, today (16), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Three suspects arrested over shooting incident in Kohuwala
byline: Three suspects have been arrested for aiding and abetting the shooting incident at Bodhiyawatte in Kohuwala, in which a 16-year-old girl was injured.

title: Female Buddhist monk dies following bus accident
byline: A 77-year-old female Buddhist monk has succumbed to injuries after being hit by a bus while crossing the road at the Minnana junction on the Avissawella-Ratnapura road.

title: Price of a cup of milk tea reduced
byline: The price of a cup of milk tea has been reduced by Rs. 10, the All-Island Restaurant Owners’ Association announced today (16).

title: SLTDA launches special program to achieve annual tourism targets
byline: The Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) has launched a special program aimed at achieving the national tourism targets set for this year.

title: One dead after sharp-weapon attack on two women in Ahangama
byline: An incident involving a sharp-weapon attack on two women has been reported from the Tittagalla area of Ahangama.

title: Two criminal gang members and female suspect brought back to Sri Lanka from Dubai
byline: Two members of notorious organized criminal gangs, who are wanted in connection with multiple homicides, were brought back to Sri Lanka from Dubai early this morning (January 16).

title: IMF says Sri Lanka’s electricity pricing policy remains tied to cost recovery
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has indicated that there is no immediate change to the electricity pricing objectives under Sri Lanka’s IMF-supported program, reaffirming the importance of maintaining cost recovery in the utility sector.

title: Harry Styles announces fourth album - with intriguing title
byline: After 1,336 days, the wait is over for Harry Styles fans - he has announced his return to music.

title: Interpol ‘Red Notice’ issued against 95 underworld figures hiding overseas – Police Spokesman
byline: Police Media Spokesperson Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) F.U. Wootler said that Interpol ‘Red Notices’ have been obtained against 95 Sri Lankan organised criminal figures currently hiding overseas.

title: S Korea’s ex-president Yoon to be jailed for five years over martial law bid
byline: South Korea’s impeached president Yoon Suk Yeol will be jailed for five years over abuse of power, obstructing justice and falsifying documents in relation to his failed martial law bid in 2024.

title: Parents protest near Edu. Ministry demanding implementation of Grade 6 reforms
byline: A protest organized by a group of parents of Grade 6 students commenced today (16) in front of the Ministry of Education, demanding the immediate implementation of proposed educational reforms for Grade 6 students.

title: Van carrying foreign tourists involved in collision near Gregory Lake
byline: A van transporting a group of foreign tourists was involved in a head-on collision near the Gregory Lake in Nuwara Eliya along the Welimada main road, police said.

title: Wikipedia inks AI deals with Microsoft, Meta and Perplexity as it marks 25th birthday
byline: Wikipedia unveiled new business deals with a slew of artificial intelligence companies on Thursday as it marked its 25th anniversary.

title: Canada, China set for ‘historic’ gains from new partnership, Carney says
byline: Canada and China are forging a new strategic partnership that promises “historic” gains by leveraging on each other’s strengths, Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney told Chinese leader Xi Jinping on Friday.

title: “There’s something truly magical about Sri Lanka” - Julie Chung in farewell message
byline: Outgoing United States Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Julie Chung, has expressed her gratitude to everyone who helped boost US–Sri Lanka ties during her nearly four-year tenure in the country and also the Sri Lankan people who she praised for their resilience and determination.

title: ITAK opposes government’s ‘Praja Shakthi’ programme
byline: The Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) has expressed strong opposition to the ‘Praja Shakthi’ national programme implemented by the government.

title: TikTok to tighten age checks in Europe as regulators ramp up pressure
byline: TikTok will start rolling out new age-detection technology across Europe in the coming weeks, it told Reuters on Friday (Jan 16), as the ByteDance-owned platform faces regulatory pressure to better identify and remove accounts belonging to children under 13.

title: Netflix inks global deal to stream Sony Pictures’ films after theatrical window
byline: Netflix and Sony Pictures Entertainment have reached a new agreement that would bring films such as “Spider-Man: Beyond the Spider-Verse” to the streaming giant’s customers worldwide after they play in cinemas, the companies said on Thursday.

title: Woman arrested for impersonating Police Inspector in Pettah
byline: A woman who was impersonating a Police Inspector has been arrested near a lodge in Pettah.

title: Star Wars boss departs after leading franchise reboot
byline: Lucasfilm president Kathleen Kennedy is stepping down after 14 years at the helm of the studio that makes Star Wars, one of the highest-grossing Hollywood franchises in history.

title: Further hearing of case against Ravi Karunanayake postponed until February
byline: The Colombo High Court today ordered that further evidence hearing in the case filed by the Commission to Investigate Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) against former Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake and Perpetual Treasuries Limited (PTL) owner Arjun Aloysius be called on February 06.

title: US Ambassador Julie Chung pays farewell call on Opposition Leader
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today (16) received a farewell call from the outgoing United States Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Julie Chung, as she prepares to conclude her four-year tenure as Washington’s top envoy to Colombo.

title: Case against ex-President Mahinda’s CSO to be taken up in June
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (16) ordered that the case involving Neville Wanniarachchi, the Chief Security Officer to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, be called on June 9.

title: Sri Lanka’s Speaker participates in 28th CSPOC in New Delhi
byline: The Sri Lankan parliamentary delegation led by Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne has participated in the 28th Conference of Speakers and Presiding Officers of the Commonwealth (CSPOC) inaugurated under the patronage of the Indian Prime Minister.

title: President issues warning to govt officials assisting drug traffickers
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has declared that his administration will never provide political protection to any individuals involved in drug trafficking.

title: Unrest at Boossa Prison brought under control - Prisons Spokesman
byline: A group of detainees who had climbed onto the rooftop of the ‘D Ward’ at the Boossa Prison and engaged in unruly behaviour, causing damage to prison property, has been brought under control a short while ago, the Prisons Spokesman said.

title: Retired Army Captain arrested with T-56 magazines and ammunition in Minuwangoda
byline: A retired Sri Lanka Army Captain has been arrested by the Police Western Province North Crimes Range at Miriswatte in Minuwangoda, while in possession of 18 T-56 assault rifle magazines and 25 rounds of live ammunition, police said.

title: One person injured in shooting at Jinthupitiya
byline: One person has reportedly been injured and hospitalized following a shooting incident at Jinthupitiya in Colombo.

title: Govt. committed to ensuring quality education to develop responsible citizens - Prime Minister
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has stated that the Government is making every effort to ensure the quality education to nurture a developed citizen that the country requires...

title: China and Canada announce tariffs relief after a high-stakes meeting between Carney and Xi
byline: Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Canadian PM Mark Carney have announced lower tariffs, signalling a reset in their countries’ relationship after a key meeting in Beijing.
